1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  **									     **
4    |  **   File:		cmdChdir.c					     **
5    |  **   First Edition:	2009-06-27					     **
6    |  **									     **
7    |  **   Authors:		Gerrit Renker					     **
8    |  **			R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>  **
9    |  **									     **
10   |  **   Description:	Implements a "chdir" command to set the working      **
11   |  **			directory upon module load/switch.		     **
12   |  **									     **
13   |  **   Exports:		cmdChDir					     **
14   |  **									     **
15   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
16   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
17   |  **					control everything		     **
18   |  **			change_dir	Communicates the target directory.   **
19   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
20   |  ****/
21   | 
22   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdChdir.c.src.html,v 1.2 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
23   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
24   | 
25   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
26   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
27   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
28   | 
29   | #include "modules_def.h"
30   | 
31   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
32   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
33   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
34   | 
35   | char		*change_dir	= NULL;
36   | 
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
39   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
40   | 
41   | /** not applicable **/
42   | 
43   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
44   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | 
47   | /** not applicable **/
48   | 
49   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
51   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
52   | 
53   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
54   | 
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | 
59   | /** not applicable **/
60   | 
61   | int cmdChDir(
62   | 	ClientData client_data,
63   | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
64   | 	int objc,
65   | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
66   | ) {
67   | 	char			*dir;		/** directory name	     **/
68   | 	struct	stat		 statinfo;	/** directory access	     **/
69   | 
70   | 	if (g_flags & ~(M_LOAD | M_SWSTATE2))
71   | 		return TCL_OK;
72   | 
73   | 	if (objc != 2) {
74   | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
75   | 				" directory", NULL))
76   | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
77   | 	}
78   | 
79   | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST)
80   | 		return TCL_OK;
81   | 
82   | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
83   | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t%s\n", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
84   | 			Tcl_GetString(objv[1]));
85   | 		return TCL_OK;
86   | 	}
87   | 
88   | 	/* check for directory existence */
89   | 	/* It is not an error if we can not ... */
90   | 	dir = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
91   | 	if ( stat(dir, &statinfo) < 0 ) {
92   | 		ErrorLogger(ERR_CHDIR, LOC, dir, g_current_module, NULL);
93   | 		return (TCL_OK);	    /** ------ EXIT PROCEDURE -----> **/
94   | 	}
95   | 	if (!S_ISDIR(statinfo.st_mode)) {
96   | 		ErrorLogger(ERR_CHDIR, LOC, dir, g_current_module, NULL);
97   | 		return (TCL_OK);	    /** ------ EXIT PROCEDURE -----> **/
98   | 	}
99   | 
100  | 	/* The actual work happens here */
101  | 	if (change_dir != NULL)
102  | 		null_free((void *) &change_dir);
103  | 	change_dir = stringer(NULL, 0, dir, NULL);
104  | 
105  | 	return TCL_OK;
106  | }
